summary: This document is an email chain from January 2, 2020, discussing a Page Six article claiming Ghislaine Maxwell is being protected in safe houses by powerful contacts. The correspondents dismiss the article as absurd and note NBC reporting she is in Colorado with wealthy ex-associates of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain discusses a Page Six article claiming she is being protected in safe houses by powerful contacts, with a note that NBC reported she is staying in Colorado with wealthy ex-associates of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly as the person whose 'ex-associates' are reportedly protecting Ghislaine Maxwell in Colorado.

connections.description: The document references Maxwell's connection to Epstein through 'ex-associates' of Epstein who are reportedly protecting her.

events.title: Page Six article published
events.description: Page Six publishes an article claiming Ghislaine Maxwell's powerful contacts are protecting her in safe houses.

events.title: Email discussion of article
events.description: Correspondents exchange emails dismissing the Page Six article as absurd and referencing NBC reporting about Maxwell's location.

keyFacts: A Page Six article on January 1, 2020, claimed Ghislaine Maxwell was being protected in safe houses by powerful contacts.
The email correspondents found the article to be absurd and not credible.
NBC had reportedly heard that Maxwell was staying in Colorado with wealthy ex-associates of Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain originated from or was copied to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating official interest.
The correspondence shows ongoing media speculation and law enforcement monitoring regarding Maxwell's whereabouts in early 2020.
